name: vscode-brautomationtools
description: Tools to edit B&R Automation Studio projects in VS Code

vscode-brautomationtools.test1.urlForHel.description: Where I got all this info

vscode-brautomationtools.build.defaultBu.description: Default build mode which will be pre-selected in build task dialogs.
enumDescriptions: Build for creation of CF card

vscode-brautomationtools.environment.aut.description: Paths where the Automation Studio versions are installed. E.g. if Automation Studio V4.6.x is installed in C:\BrAutomation\AS46, the install path is C:\BrAutomation

vscode-brautomationtools.environment.pvi.description: Paths where the PVI versions are installed. E.g. if PVI V4.6.x is installed in C:\BrAutomation\PVI\V4.6, the install path is C:\BrAutomation\PVI

asProjectFile.description: The (absolute?) path of the Automation Studio project file, e.g. 'C:\projects\MyFirstProject\MyFirstProject.apj'. If not set, a dialog will ask for the project on every execution.

asBuildMode.description: The build mode for this task. If not set, a dialog will ask for the build mode on every execution.
enumDescriptions: Build for creation of CF card

asConfiguration.description: The AS configuration which will be built. If not set, a dialog will ask for the configuration on every execution.

buildForSimulation.description: Always build project for ArSim target. If not set or set to false, the setting of the Automation Studio project configuration is used

buildRUCPackage.description: Always create RUC package. If not set or set to false, the setting of the Automation Studio project configuration is used

buildCrossReferences.description: Build only cross reference and header files. If set to true, no binaries are created

cleanGenerated.description: Cleans all generated .h and .a files. ATTENTION this affects all configurations!

additionalArguments.description: Additional arguments for Br.As.Build.exe. Write each argument as a separate array element, as strings with whitespaces get automatically quoted. For the same reason e.g. paths with whitespaces do not need to be quoted manually

asProjectFile.description: The (absolute?) path of the Automation Studio project file, e.g. 'C:\projects\MyFirstProject\MyFirstProject.apj'. If not set, a dialog will ask for the project on every execution.

asConfiguration.description: The AS configuration which will be transfered. If not set, a dialog will ask for the configuration on every execution.

deviceInterface.description: Interface type of the device (e.g. tcpip) (/IF parameter)

sourceNode.description: INA source node number for the connection. This value should differ from your AS connection to prevent connection losses (/SA parameter)

destinationAddress.description: Address of the transfer destination. Can be an IP address or a host name (/IP parameter)

destinationPort.description: Port of the transfer destination. Default ports: ANSL on real PLC = 11169; ANSL on ArSim = 11160 (/PT parameter)

connectionEstablishedTimeout.description: Maximum time in s permitted to elapse before a valid connection must be established (WT parameter in connection command)

remoteParameters.description: Parameters to establish a remote connection

enumDescriptions: All tasks will be stopped during installation process (RECOMMENDED)
Only changed tasks will be stopped during installation process
A reboot is forced and the installation will be executed during startup
All memory (permanent, remanent) will be deleted and a reboot will be executed during installation
Allows installation with complete data loss (e.g. change of configuration ID)
Allows installation where a partitioning of the flash will be executed. Data on the flash may be lost.
Allows only an installation without data loss of flash or remanent data.

keepPVValues.description: Try to keep process variable values

executeInitExit.description: Execute INIT and EXIT subroutines of changed tasks during transfer

tryToBootInRUNMode.description: Try to boot in RUN mode whenever a reboot of the target is required or forced

pviTransferExecutionArgumets.description: Command line arguments for PVITransfer.exe. Write each argument as a separate array element, as strings with whitespaces get automatically quoted. For the same reason e.g. paths with whitespaces do not need to be quoted manually

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
